about.title: About Invent-Tree
about.subHeading: Uncovering the pulse of the people through accurate, data-driven political surveys.

whoWeAre.title: Who We Are
whoWeAre.description: Invent-Tree is a leading political survey and polling firm dedicated to providing high-quality, unbiased data to inform decision-making. With over a decade of experience, we’ve worked with political campaigns, advocacy groups, and media outlets to deliver insights that matter.
whoWeAre.para1: We are a multidisciplinary team of data scientists, statisticians, political analysts, and communication experts who share one mission — to decode public opinion. Our focus is on combining traditional research with cutting-edge digital methodologies to ensure accuracy and reliability.
whoWeAre.para2: From grassroots-level surveys in rural regions to large-scale nationwide polls, Invent-Tree ensures every voice is heard. We take pride in our neutrality and commitment to evidence-based insights that empower stakeholders to take informed actions.

ourMission.title: Our Mission
ourMission.para1: To provide polling data that reflects the voice of the public, enabling informed decisions in the political landscape.
ourMission.para2: At Invent-Tree, we believe data should inspire trust and clarity. Our mission is not only to measure public opinion but also to make it accessible and understandable for policymakers, organizations, and the public at large.
ourMission.para3: By embracing innovation in data collection and analytics, we strive to bridge the gap between people and decision-makers. Our ultimate goal is to foster a transparent democratic process where evidence, not assumption, drives progress.

whoChooseUs.title: Why Choose Invent-Tree?
whoChooseUs.point1: Precision: Advanced statistical methods and representative sampling.
whoChooseUs.point2: Integrity: Strict adherence to ethical polling standards.
whoChooseUs.point3: Customization: Polls designed to answer your specific questions.

governance.title: Governance & Ethics Framework
governance.description: Our commitment to ethical operations, transparency, and accountability in all business practices.

sections.heading: Integrity & Honesty
sections.text: We act with fairness, transparency, and honesty in all dealings with clients, vendors, and stakeholders.

sections.heading: Political Neutrality
sections.text: While we provide political consultancy, we do not promote any personal or organizational bias. Our services are data-driven, impartial, and professional.

sections.heading: Confidentiality
sections.text: All employees must maintain strict confidentiality regarding client data, strategies, or internal processes.

sections.heading: Conflict of Interest
sections.text: Employees must disclose any personal or professional conflict of interest and refrain from activities that compromise Invent-Tree's integrity.

sections.heading: Respect & Professionalism
sections.text: We promote a respectful, harassment-free workplace. Discrimination, hate speech, or offensive behavior will not be tolerated.

sections.heading: Compliance
sections.text: All staff are required to comply with laws, regulations, and company policies.

sections.heading: Purpose
sections.text: To provide a safe channel for reporting misconduct without fear of retaliation.

sections.heading: Scope
sections.text: Covers fraud, corruption, discrimination, harassment, misuse of resources, or violations of law and company policy.

sections.heading: Reporting Process
sections.text: Reports may be made confidentially via compliance@invent-tree.com. Anonymous complaints will also be considered, but detailed information is encouraged.

sections.heading: Protection
sections.text: Whistleblowers will not face retaliation or adverse action for raising genuine concerns in good faith.

sections.heading: Investigation
sections.text: All reports will be investigated by the compliance team or designated officers, with findings shared with management.

sections.heading: Prohibition
sections.text: Employees must not offer, solicit, or accept bribes, kickbacks, or improper benefits. Political donations on behalf of Invent-Tree are prohibited unless approved by management and permitted by law.

sections.heading: Gifts & Hospitality
sections.text: Reasonable, customary business courtesies are permitted, but extravagant or suspicious gifts must be reported to HR/compliance.

sections.heading: Reporting
sections.text: Suspected violations must be reported under the Whistleblower Policy.

sections.heading: Consequences
sections.text: Violations may result in disciplinary action, termination, and legal penalties.

sections.heading: Applicable Laws
sections.text: The Information Technology Act, 2000 and rules thereunder. The Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023. Election Commission of India regulations regarding political consulting, advertising, and funding. Tax, GST, labor, and corporate governance laws.

sections.heading: Responsibilities
sections.text: Employees must be aware of and comply with applicable laws. Management ensures training, monitoring, and enforcement of compliance.

sections.heading: Contracts
sections.text: All services are formalized via written agreements defining scope, deliverables, timelines, and fees.

sections.heading: Confidentiality
sections.text: Client data and strategies are protected under NDAs and strict internal confidentiality protocols.

sections.heading: Transparency
sections.text: We provide accurate project status updates and billing clarity.

sections.heading: Dispute Resolution
sections.text: Disputes will first be attempted to be resolved amicably. If unresolved, matters will be referred to arbitration under the Arbitration and Conciliation Act, 1996 (India).

sections.heading: Venue Compliance
sections.text: All venues must meet fire safety, legal occupancy, and local authority requirements.

sections.heading: Emergency Preparedness
sections.text: Evacuation plans must be communicated to staff and volunteers. Medical assistance and security must be available on-site.

sections.heading: Risk Assessment
sections.text: Events will undergo risk analysis covering crowd control, VIP security, and technical safety.

sections.heading: Insurance
sections.text: Event insurance will be arranged where required, covering liability and accidents.

sections.heading: Vendor Selection
sections.text: Vendors are selected based on merit, quality, and compliance—not favoritism or kickbacks.

sections.heading: Agreements
sections.text: All vendor relationships will be documented in contracts covering service levels, confidentiality, and compliance.

sections.heading: Compliance
sections.text: Vendors must comply with our Anti-Corruption, Privacy, and Event Safety policies.

sections.heading: Monitoring
sections.text: Vendor performance will be periodically reviewed.

sections.heading: Standards
sections.text: All projects follow industry best practices in design, development, event management, and consulting.

sections.heading: Timeliness
sections.text: We commit to delivering on agreed timelines, with proactive communication of any delays.

sections.heading: Accuracy
sections.text: Data, reports, and analyses provided to clients will be fact-checked, validated, and unbiased.

sections.heading: Continuous Improvement
sections.text: We maintain a feedback loop to improve processes and client experience.

client-service.title: Client & Service Delivery Excellence
client-service.description: Policies ensuring exceptional service delivery, professional partnerships, and quality project management.

items.title: Client Engagement Policy
items.content: Our Client Engagement Policy establishes the framework for professional, effective, and mutually beneficial client relationships. This policy outlines our commitment to understanding client needs, providing transparent communication, and delivering exceptional service quality. We detail our engagement process from initial consultation through project completion, including regular progress updates, stakeholder meetings, and feedback incorporation. The policy ensures consistent service standards, clear expectations management, and professional conduct throughout all client interactions, fostering long-term partnerships built on trust and results.

items.title: Event Safety & Risk Management Policy
items.content: Our comprehensive Event Safety & Risk Management Policy ensures the security and well-being of all participants in our events, surveys, and field operations. This policy covers risk assessment procedures, safety protocols, emergency response plans, and insurance requirements. We address venue safety standards, crowd management, weather contingencies, and health considerations. The policy includes staff training requirements, equipment safety checks, and incident reporting procedures. Regular safety audits and continuous improvement processes ensure our events maintain the highest safety standards while delivering effective political engagement and research activities.

items.title: Vendor & Partner Policy
items.content: Our Vendor & Partner Policy establishes rigorous standards for selecting, managing, and maintaining relationships with external suppliers and strategic partners. This policy outlines due diligence procedures, performance evaluation criteria, and ongoing monitoring requirements. We ensure all partners meet our ethical standards, quality expectations, and compliance requirements. The policy covers contract management, payment terms, confidentiality obligations, and termination procedures. Regular partner assessments and feedback mechanisms maintain high-quality relationships that enhance our service delivery capabilities while protecting client interests.

items.title: Quality Assurance & Project Delivery Policy
items.content: Our Quality Assurance & Project Delivery Policy guarantees consistent, high-quality outcomes across all client engagements. This comprehensive framework includes project planning methodologies, milestone tracking, quality checkpoints, and performance metrics. We detail our quality control processes, testing procedures, and validation mechanisms for all deliverables. The policy establishes clear accountability structures, review processes, and continuous improvement protocols. Regular quality audits, client feedback integration, and team performance assessments ensure we consistently exceed expectations while maintaining our reputation for excellence in political consulting and research services.

data-protection.title: Data Protection & Security Framework
data-protection.description: Comprehensive policies protecting sensitive information and ensuring robust cybersecurity measures.

sections.heading: Purpose
sections.text: This policy ensures lawful, fair, and transparent processing of personal data collected through surveys, consultancy, digital platforms, and events.

sections.heading: Scope
sections.text: Applies to all employees, contractors, vendors, and volunteers handling data for Invent-Tree.

sections.heading: Data Principles
sections.text: Consent-based collection. Purpose limitation – data used only for stated objectives. Minimal collection – only what is necessary. Retention control – data retained only as long as necessary. Secure disposal – anonymization or deletion after use.

sections.heading: Roles & Responsibilities
sections.text: Data Protection Officer (DPO) – oversees compliance and responds to user rights requests. Employees – must handle data securely and report incidents.

sections.heading: User Rights
sections.text: Data principals (users) may request access, correction, deletion, or withdrawal of consent at any time by writing to privacy@invent-tree.com.

sections.heading: Objectives
sections.text: Protect confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information. Prevent unauthorized access, loss, or misuse of company or client data.

sections.heading: Controls
sections.text: Access Control – role-based permissions, 2FA for sensitive systems. Encryption – all sensitive data stored/transmitted in encrypted form. Backups – secure, tested backups maintained regularly. Device Security – company devices must have updated antivirus, firewalls, and restricted USB access.

sections.heading: Responsibilities
sections.text: All employees must follow secure password practices. IT team must monitor systems and perform vulnerability scans.

sections.heading: Compliance
sections.text: Violations of this policy may result in disciplinary action or termination.

sections.heading: Objective
sections.text: To ensure preparedness and rapid response in case of cyber threats, breaches, or attacks.

sections.heading: Threat Management
sections.text: Prevention – firewalls, intrusion detection, security audits. Detection – continuous monitoring of systems, suspicious login alerts. Response – incidents reported immediately to the Cybersecurity Team. Recovery – affected systems isolated, restored from backups, vulnerabilities patched.

sections.heading: Incident Reporting
sections.text: All employees must report suspected cyber incidents within 2 hours to security@invent-tree.com.

sections.heading: Escalation
sections.text: Serious breaches involving personal data must be reported to regulators within 72 hours as per DPDP Act requirements.

sections.heading: Awareness & Training
sections.text: All staff undergo regular cybersecurity awareness programs.

sections.heading: Objective
sections.text: To protect sensitive client, survey, campaign, and company information from unauthorized disclosure.

sections.heading: Scope
sections.text: Applies to employees, contractors, interns, volunteers, vendors, and any third party with access to confidential information.

sections.heading: Definition of Confidential Information
sections.text: Includes (but is not limited to): Client strategies, polling data, campaign plans. Survey results and analytics. Proprietary tools, code, and designs. Contracts, financial data, and internal communications.

sections.heading: Obligations
sections.text: Confidential information must only be used for authorized purposes. No disclosure to third parties without written approval. All documents/files must be stored securely.

sections.heading: Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA)
sections.text: All employees and vendors must sign NDAs before accessing sensitive information.

sections.heading: Duration
sections.text: Confidentiality obligations extend beyond employment/contract termination.

media-communication.title: Media & Communication Standards
media-communication.description: Policies governing public communications, media interactions, and brand representation.

sections.heading: Purpose
sections.text: To ensure professional, consistent, and compliant use of social media by Invent-Tree staff, interns, volunteers, and partners.

sections.heading: Official Accounts
sections.text: Only authorized staff may post on official company accounts. All posts must align with the company's brand values and legal compliance.

sections.heading: Employee/Volunteer Use
sections.text: Employees may mention Invent-Tree in personal posts but must include disclaimers (e.g., "views are my own"). Sharing confidential client or campaign data on personal accounts is strictly prohibited.

sections.heading: Prohibited Content
sections.text: Hate speech, offensive remarks, or politically partisan posts on official handles. False or misleading claims. Unauthorized leaks of survey, campaign, or strategy data.

sections.heading: Crisis Management
sections.text: In case of online controversy, only authorized spokespersons may respond. Employees must not engage in public arguments.

sections.heading: Objective
sections.text: To regulate interactions with media and ensure consistent, accurate communication.

sections.heading: Authorized Spokespersons
sections.text: Only designated representatives (approved by management) may give interviews, statements, or press releases. Other employees/volunteers must direct media inquiries to the PR/Communications team.

sections.heading: Guidelines for Communication
sections.text: All media responses must be factual, professional, and non-partisan unless otherwise contracted. Sensitive matters must be cleared with legal/compliance before being shared. "No comment" is acceptable when appropriate.

sections.heading: Confidentiality
sections.text: Under no circumstances should internal documents, polling data, or strategy discussions be disclosed to media without written approval.

sections.heading: Purpose
sections.text: To ensure consistent branding and content across all platforms, services, and campaigns handled by Invent-Tree.

sections.heading: Brand Guidelines
sections.text: Use official logos, colors, and taglines only in approved formats. All marketing and campaign material must follow Invent-Tree's brand style guide.

sections.heading: Content Standards
sections.text: All content must be accurate, non-defamatory, and respectful. Political messaging must comply with Election Commission guidelines. Plagiarism is prohibited; original or licensed content must be used.

sections.heading: Approval Process
sections.text: Campaign content must be approved by the communications lead before publication. Sensitive political or event content requires legal and compliance review.

sections.heading: Consistency Across Platforms
sections.text: Messaging, tone, and visuals must remain consistent across websites, apps, social media, events, and printed materials.

survey-research.title: Survey & Research Integrity
survey-research.description: Policies ensuring ethical research practices, accurate data collection, and transparent reporting.

sections.heading: Objective
sections.text: To ensure that all surveys, polls, and research conducted by Invent-Tree are accurate, impartial, and ethical.

sections.heading: Ethical Standards
sections.text: Surveys must be designed and conducted without manipulation or bias. Sample groups must represent the target population fairly. Results will not be fabricated, distorted, or selectively reported.

sections.heading: Transparency
sections.text: Methodologies, sample sizes, and margins of error will be disclosed where appropriate. Sponsorships or affiliations influencing research will be declared.

sections.heading: Prohibited Practices
sections.text: Push polling or misleading questions designed to manipulate respondents. Suppression or alteration of unfavorable results.

sections.heading: Oversight
sections.text: All surveys will be reviewed by the Research & Compliance team before release.

sections.heading: Informed Consent
sections.text: Respondents must be informed about the purpose, use, and storage of their data before participation. Participation is voluntary, and consent must be explicitly obtained (written, digital, or verbal recorded).

sections.heading: Anonymity
sections.text: Individual responses will remain confidential unless explicit consent is given for attribution. Survey data will be aggregated to prevent identification of individuals.

sections.heading: Right to Withdraw
sections.text: Respondents may withdraw participation at any stage without penalty.

sections.heading: Sensitive Data
sections.text: Collection of sensitive political, religious, or personal information will require heightened safeguards under the DPDP Act.

sections.heading: Accuracy
sections.text: Data analysis must follow industry-standard statistical methods. Errors discovered post-publication must be corrected promptly and transparently.

sections.heading: Objectivity
sections.text: Reports must present findings factually, without distortion to favor a particular client or agenda. Subjective interpretations must be clearly distinguished from data-driven insights.

sections.heading: Publication
sections.text: Reports intended for public release must be reviewed and approved by the Research Director and Compliance Officer. Confidential client-specific reports will not be shared externally without authorization.

sections.heading: Data Security
sections.text: All raw data and analytics must be stored securely and only accessible to authorized personnel.

specialized.title: Specialized Political Services
specialized.description: Policies governing our specialized political consulting, campaign services, and public engagement activities.

sections.heading: Objective
sections.text: To ensure all campaign-related activities managed by Invent-Tree comply with Indian electoral laws and ethical standards.

sections.heading: Legal Compliance
sections.text: Adherence to the Representation of People Act, 1951. Compliance with Election Commission of India (ECI) guidelines, including Model Code of Conduct. Transparency in campaign financing, advertising, and expenditure reporting.

sections.heading: Prohibited Activities
sections.text: Use of government resources for campaign purposes. Promotion of hate speech, communal targeting, or unlawful propaganda. Acceptance of foreign funding without FCRA approval.

sections.heading: Documentation
sections.text: All campaign strategies, finances, and outreach activities must be documented for audit and regulatory purposes.

sections.heading: Purpose
sections.text: To define the rules and processes for Invent-Tree's War Room operations during campaigns.

sections.heading: Operations
sections.text: Centralized command center for real-time monitoring of events, media, and voter sentiment. Daily situation reports (SitReps) shared with campaign leadership. Escalation of urgent issues to the Crisis Response Team.

sections.heading: Monitoring Areas
sections.text: Media tracking: news, social media, and online discussions. Opposition monitoring: fact-checking and rapid counter-strategies. Election-day tracking: turnout, booth operations, and volunteer coordination.

sections.heading: Confidentiality
sections.text: War room data and discussions are highly confidential and must not be shared externally.

sections.heading: Objective
sections.text: To guide ethical voter engagement through data-driven micro-targeting and booth-level strategy.

sections.heading: Voter Segmentation
sections.text: Segmentation based on lawful demographic, behavioral, and polling data. Strict prohibition of using illegally obtained personal data.

sections.heading: Messaging
sections.text: Messages tailored to voter groups must remain truthful and respectful. No disinformation, fake news, or hate-oriented content permitted.

sections.heading: Booth Strategy
sections.text: Volunteers must be trained in lawful booth management. Transportation, voter reminders, and turnout efforts must comply with ECI guidelines.

sections.heading: Data Handling
sections.text: Booth-level data must be securely stored and anonymized where required.

sections.heading: Objective
sections.text: To ensure that outreach activities strengthen voter trust and comply with laws.

sections.heading: Outreach Activities
sections.text: Town halls, rallies, and fundraising events. Door-to-door canvassing and phone banking. Voter education initiatives about election processes.

sections.heading: Ethical Guidelines
sections.text: Outreach must avoid discriminatory or divisive messaging. No voter intimidation or inducements (cash, gifts, liquor, etc.). Respect for local communities, traditions, and sensitivities.

sections.heading: Volunteer Conduct
sections.text: Volunteers must carry proper ID when representing campaigns. All interactions should be polite, factual, and non-aggressive.

health-safety.title: Health & Safety Commitment
health-safety.description: Policies ensuring the well-being and safety of our team members, clients, and communities.

sections.heading: Objective
sections.text: To provide a safe and healthy workplace for all employees, interns, and volunteers of Invent-Tree.

sections.heading: Responsibilities
sections.text: Management: Ensure compliance with workplace safety laws and maintain safe facilities. Employees: Follow safety protocols, report hazards, and use equipment responsibly.

sections.heading: Safety Measures
sections.text: Fire safety equipment must be installed and regularly tested. First aid kits available at all offices and event sites. Regular workplace inspections to identify and mitigate hazards.

sections.heading: Training
sections.text: Employees and volunteers will receive safety training relevant to their roles (e.g., event safety, tech/data handling).

sections.heading: Reporting
sections.text: Accidents, injuries, or unsafe conditions must be reported immediately to HR or the designated Safety Officer.

sections.heading: Purpose
sections.text: To ensure the safety and security of employees, volunteers, and partners while traveling for work or events.

sections.heading: Travel Guidelines
sections.text: Travel must be booked through approved vendors where possible. Accommodation must meet safety standards. Employees must share travel itineraries with their reporting manager.

sections.heading: Security Protocols
sections.text: High-risk travel (political events, VIP rallies, sensitive areas) requires advance security planning. Identity cards must be carried at all times during official travel. Emergency contacts and support must be available 24/7 for field staff.

sections.heading: Expenses
sections.text: Reimbursements will be processed under the Expense Reimbursement Policy.

sections.heading: Objective
sections.text: To support the mental well-being of employees and volunteers working under high-pressure conditions such as campaigns, deadlines, and events.

sections.heading: Commitment
sections.text: Encourage work-life balance and reasonable working hours. Provide access to counseling support (internal or external). Foster an open, stigma-free environment for discussing mental health.

sections.heading: Preventive Measures
sections.text: Managers must monitor workload distribution to prevent burnout. Regular breaks and rest periods encouraged during long campaigns or events.

sections.heading: Confidentiality
sections.text: All mental health discussions will be treated as confidential.

sections.heading: Support Channels
sections.text: Employees may reach out to HR or designated wellness officers for assistance.

hr-policies.title: Human Resources & People Management
hr-policies.description: Policies governing recruitment, employee relations, volunteer management, and workplace practices.

sections.heading: Objective
sections.text: Invent-Tree is committed to fair, transparent, and merit-based recruitment practices.

sections.heading: Equal Opportunity
sections.text: We provide equal employment opportunities regardless of caste, religion, gender, age, disability, or political affiliation.

sections.heading: Recruitment Process
sections.text: Open positions will be advertised publicly. Candidates will be evaluated based on skills, qualifications, and cultural fit. Background verification may be conducted for sensitive roles.

sections.heading: Anti-Discrimination
sections.text: Bias, favoritism, or discrimination in hiring is strictly prohibited.

sections.heading: Confidentiality
sections.text: All applicant information will be treated as confidential.

sections.heading: Role of Volunteers
sections.text: Volunteers play a vital role in surveys, events, campaigns, and outreach programs.

sections.heading: Recruitment
sections.text: Volunteers will be recruited through campaigns, outreach, or referrals. A screening process will be applied where necessary.

sections.heading: Training
sections.text: All volunteers will receive orientation on company values, safety, and specific tasks.

sections.heading: Conduct
sections.text: Volunteers must maintain confidentiality of client/campaign information. Misconduct, hate speech, or violence will result in termination of volunteer engagement.

sections.heading: Recognition
sections.text: Outstanding volunteers may be recognized through certificates, recommendations, or stipends where applicable.

sections.heading: Code of Conduct
sections.text: Employees must: Act with professionalism and integrity. Respect colleagues and clients. Avoid conflicts of interest. Abide by confidentiality and security policies.

sections.heading: Working Hours
sections.text: Standard office hours: 9:00 AM - 6:00 PM (flexible for campaign/event schedules). Remote work permitted for designated roles, with prior approval.

sections.heading: Leave Types
sections.text: Casual Leave (CL): 12 days annually. Sick Leave (SL): 10 days annually. Earned Leave (EL): As per statutory requirements. Maternity/Paternity Leave: As per Indian labor laws.

sections.heading: Leave Procedure
sections.text: Employees must apply via the HR system or email at least 3 days in advance (except emergencies).

sections.heading: Disciplinary Action
sections.text: Misconduct, insubordination, or policy violations may lead to warnings, suspension, or termination.

sections.heading: Objective
sections.text: To provide structured learning opportunities for students and young professionals while contributing to Invent-Tree's projects.

sections.heading: Duration & Engagement
sections.text: Internship periods: 1–6 months. Interns may work on research, tech, events, and communication projects.

sections.heading: Stipend & Benefits
sections.text: Interns may receive stipends as per company discretion and scheme eligibility (UP Startup Policy, NAPS, AICTE, etc.). Certificates will be issued on successful completion.

sections.heading: Supervision
sections.text: Interns will be assigned mentors and provided feedback on performance.

sections.heading: Confidentiality & Conduct
sections.text: Interns must sign NDAs and adhere to company's Code of Conduct.

sections.heading: Conversion to Employment
sections.text: Outstanding interns may be offered permanent roles.

finance.title: Financial Management & Compliance
finance.description: Policies governing financial operations, accounting standards, expense management, and fundraising compliance.

sections.heading: Objective
sections.text: To ensure accurate, transparent, and accountable financial practices at Invent-Tree.

sections.heading: Accounting Standards
sections.text: All accounts will be maintained in compliance with Indian Accounting Standards and Companies Act requirements. Books of accounts will be updated regularly and subject to internal/external audits.

sections.heading: Financial Controls
sections.text: Dual authorization for major expenses. Segregation of duties between approval, payment, and accounting functions. Regular reconciliation of bank accounts.

sections.heading: Budgeting
sections.text: Annual budgets will be prepared and reviewed by management. Any unplanned expenditure above ₹50,000 requires management approval.

sections.heading: Record Retention
sections.text: Financial records will be retained for at least 8 years or as required by law.

sections.heading: Eligibility
sections.text: Employees, contractors, interns, and volunteers may claim reimbursement for approved business expenses (travel, accommodation, food, event logistics).

sections.heading: Conditions
sections.text: Expenses must be work-related and approved by the reporting manager. Claims must be supported by original receipts/invoices. Claims must be submitted within 30 days of the expense.

sections.heading: Non-Reimbursable Expenses
sections.text: Personal purchases, entertainment, or leisure costs. Alcoholic beverages (unless specifically approved for client events). Fines, penalties, or illegal payments.

sections.heading: Payment
sections.text: Approved reimbursements will be processed within 15 working days via bank transfer.

sections.heading: Objective
sections.text: To ensure all fundraising activities and donations comply with applicable laws and regulations.

sections.heading: Legal Compliance
sections.text: All fundraising activities must comply with the Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Act (FCRA) 2010, Income Tax Act provisions, and other applicable regulations.

sections.heading: Documentation
sections.text: Proper records must be maintained for all donations received, including donor details, amounts, and purposes. All donations must be properly acknowledged and receipted.

sections.heading: Reporting
sections.text: Regular reports on fundraising activities and fund utilization must be prepared for management and regulatory authorities as required.

sections.heading: Transparency
sections.text: Financial statements and fundraising reports will be made available for audit and regulatory review.

policy.description: At Invent-Tree, transparency and accountability form the cornerstone of our operations. Our comprehensive policy framework ensures ethical practices, legal compliance, and unwavering commitment to client trust across all aspects of our political consulting and research services.

footer.title: These policies reflect Invent-Tree's unwavering commitment to ethics, responsibility, and accountability in all aspects of our operations. We regularly review and update our policies to ensure they meet the highest professional standards and regulatory requirements.
